title.value: Bidirectional Learning for Offline Model-based Biological Sequence Design
title.justification: Extracted directly from the title of the paper.
title.quote: Bidirectional Learning for Offline Model-based Biological Sequence Design

extractions.description: This paper introduces a framework for offline model-based biological sequence design. It leverages a forward and backward mapping technique known as bidirectional learning while incorporating rich biophysical information from pre-trained language models and proposes a learning rate adaptation module named Adaptive-η. Experimental results across various DNA and protein sequence design tasks illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed methods.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments on DNA and protein sequence design tasks to verify the effectiveness of the proposed algorithms.
type.quote: Experimental results on DNA/protein sequence design tasks verify the effectiveness of our algorithm.

name.justification: The paper focuses primarily on the design of biological sequences like DNA and protein sequences.
name.quote: In this paper, we focus on biological sequence design, including DNA/protein sequence, with the goal of maximizing some specified property of these sequences.

name.justification: The paper's methods and objective revolve around maximizing an unknown objective based on a static dataset, fitting well within the scope of model-based optimization.
name.quote: Offline model-based optimization aims to maximize a black-box objective function with a static dataset of designs and their scores.

name.justification: The paper leverages deep learning techniques, specifically pre-trained language models, for tasks in biological sequence design.
name.quote: Considering this, we construct a proxy model by combining a finite-width pre-trained LM with an additional layer...and compute the average of token embeddings as the extracted feature, which is fed into the linear layer to build the proxy.

name.justification: The paper proposes a learning rate adaptation module called Adaptive-η designed to be compatible with all gradient-based algorithms for offline model-based optimization.
name.quote: As the first learning rate adaptation module in offline model-based optimization, Adaptive-η allows learning rate adaptation for any gradient-based algorithm.

is_contributed.justification: Adaptive-η is introduced as a novel contribution in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We further extend this bi-level optimization framework to Adaptive-η. As the first learning rate tuning scheme in offline model-based optimization, Adaptive-η allows learning rate adaptation for any gradient-based algorithm.

is_executed.justification: Experimental results validate its execution as part of the study.
is_executed.quote: Experiments on DNA and protein sequence design tasks verify the effectiveness of BIB and Adaptive-η.

is_compared.justification: The effectiveness of Adaptive-η is compared against baseline models in the experimental section.
is_compared.quote: As shown in Table 3, Adaptive-η provides a consistent gain for all scenarios, which demonstrates the widespread applicability and effectiveness of the module.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Adaptive-η is an original contribution of this paper rather than being referenced from another paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We further extend this bi-level optimization framework to Adaptive-η. As the first learning rate tuning scheme in offline model-based optimization, Adaptive-η allows learning rate adaptation for any gradient-based algorithm.

name.justification: The dataset is used in experiments for evaluating DNA sequence design by maximizing the binding activity score with transcription factors.
name.quote: We conduct experiments on two DNA tasks: TFBind8(r)...following (Chen et al., 2022c).

referenced_paper_title.value: Bidirectional Learning for Offline Model-based Biological Sequence Design
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is directly used within the scope of this paper's own experimental evaluations.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We conduct experiments on two DNA tasks: TFBind8(r)...following (Chen et al., 2022c).

name.justification: The dataset is stated to be used for evaluating the design of 10-length DNA sequences by maximizing binding activity.
name.quote: Experimental results on DNA/protein sequence design tasks verify the effectiveness of our algorithm.
